entry.title: Combined summary - A Note on Public Communication
entry.summary: The Lightning-dev mailing list has been the subject of recent discussions surrounding public communication and moderation. Members have expressed concerns about private communication and a lack of support for freedom of expression in the community. However, others have emphasized the importance of holding conversations in public, especially for technical decisions, to document options considered and provide an interface point for new participants to contribute.There have also been calls for proportionality and level-headedness in discussions of personal conflicts. One member highlighted the need to avoid getting involved in personal conflicts that can damage the ability to discuss and exchange ideas. Another member suggested adding more moderators to the mailing list to prevent it from dying due to a decrease in communication.In an email thread on the Lightning-dev mailing list, Antoine Riard defended his post regarding "frivolous legal claims" being used between bitcoin developers/organizations that could lead to a distortion of neutrality in development and a chilling effect on technical discussions. He believes it is his legal right and moral duty to inform the community of what is happening. Despite this, he acknowledges that conflicts are not binary and people can disagree on the set of legal and moral principles to apply.Another member advised Jorge Tim贸n to be mindful of his words when communicating on the mailing list and to communicate in a way that recruits allies and demonstrates good faith if he wishes to affect change. Keags also advised Jorge to take greater care in seeing how his words are understood by others as this could elicit greater sympathy and cooperation.Despite the issues with the list's moderation, it remains the most accessible way for people to search history and implement ideas proposed in the present for future use. The author expresses concern about losing these properties if the community changes communication tools but is open to changing if these properties can be retained.
